Instance.description: Zone director used to control the objects and interactions on the acting studio lot.

TunableList.name: performance_objects
TunableList.description: A mapping of performance objects (i.e. lights, green screen, vfx machine) and the state they should be put into when the performance starts/stops.

TunableTuple.name: performance_object_states
TunableTuple.description: States that should be applied to the objects before, during, and after the performance. If the object doesn't have the necessary state then nothing will happen.

TunableList.name: performance_states
TunableList.description: States to set on the object when the performance starts.

Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableList.name: post_performance_states
TunableList.description: States set on the object when the performance is over.

Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableList.name: pre_performance_states
TunableList.description: States to set on the object when the zone loads.

TunableTuple.description: A state to set on an object as well as a perk that will skip setting the state.

TunableVariant.name: skip_with_perk
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows skipping this state change if the active Sim has a tuned perk.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If the active Sim has this perk, this state won't be set on the tuned objects. For instance, if the Sim has the Established Name perk, they don't need to use the hair and makeup chair. This can prevent those objects from glowing in that case.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableEnum.name: performance_object_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag for the performance object.

TunableTuple.name: post_performance_time_between_wrap_and_lights
TunableTuple.display: Post Performance Time Between Wrap And Lights
TunableTuple.description: How long after the 'that's a wrap' sound until the post-performance state should be swapped on all the objects (lights, greenscreen, etc.)

TunableTuple.name: post_performance_time_remaining
TunableTuple.description: This is how long the gig should last once the player completes the final interaction. Regardless of how long the timer shows, once the player finishes the final interaction, we'll set the gig to end in this tuned amount of time. Note: This should be enough time to encompass both the Post Performance Time To Wrap Callout and Post Performance time Between Wrap And Lights time spans.

TunableTuple.name: post_performance_time_to_wrap_callout
TunableTuple.display: Post Performance Time To Wrap Callout
TunableTuple.description: How long, after the Player completes the entire gig, until the 'That's a wrap' sound should play.

TunableList.name: stage_marks
TunableList.description: A mapping of stage marker tags to the interactions that should be added to them for this gig. These interactions will be applied to the stage mark/object on zone load.

TunableList.name: scene_interactions
TunableList.description: The set of interactions that will be added to the stage mark object.

Tunable.description: A Super Interaction that should be added to the stage mark object.

TunableEnum.name: stage_mark_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag for the stage mark object the tuned scene interactions should be on.

Tunable.name: start_performance_interaction
Tunable.description: A reference to the interaction that indicates the performance is starting. This is what triggers all of the state changes in the Performance Object tuning.

TunableTuple.name: thats_a_wrap_audio
TunableTuple.description: The sound to play when the player has completed the performance and the Post Performance Time To Wrap Callout time has passed.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.
